DataElement.preferredName: Graft Cell CD52 Monoclonal Antibody Manipulation Prior Infusion Procedure Occurrence Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of CD52 monoclonal antibody, an antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous fast growing cells i.e., hybridoma; hybridoma cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous, used to alter cells to be transplanted from a donor to a recipient prior to infusion, a method of putting fluids or drugs into the bloodstream, of the recipient.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Graft Cell CD52 Monoclonal Antibody Manipulation Prior Infusion Procedure Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the alteration of cells to be transplanted from a donor to a recipient using a anti-CD52 monoclonal antibody, an antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous fast growing cells i.e., hybridoma; hybridoma cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous, prior to infusion, a method of putting fluids or drugs into the bloodstream, of the recipient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.:The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid. Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves.

Concepts.definition: Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

Property.preferredName: CDW52 wt Allele Monoclonal Antibody Manipulation Prior Infusion Occurrence
Property.preferredDefinition: Human CD52 wild-type allele is located within 1p36 and is approximately 3 kb in length. This allele, which encodes CAMPATH-1 antigen immunoprotein, plays a role in inflammatory response and carbohydrate trafficking; however, neither role has been substantiated.:An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous population of hybrid cells i.e., hybridoma; hybrid cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. They are widely used in cancer detection, diagnosis and treatment.:Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.:Earlier in time or order.:A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: Human CD52 wild-type allele is located within 1p36 and is approximately 3 kb in length. This allele, which encodes CAMPATH-1 antigen immunoprotein, plays a role in inflammatory response and carbohydrate trafficking; however, neither role has been substantiated.

An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous fast-growing cells i.e., hybridoma. Hybridoma cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. They are widely used in cancer detection, diagnosis, and treatment.
Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the subdivision of a particular kind of CD52 monoclonal antibody.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
